hero.headline: Welcome to Ekaant—Agro Tourism Retreat Near Bor Tiger Reserve, Maharashtra
hero.subheadline: Where silence heals, and nature whispers.....

about.title: Ekaant (एकांत)
description: Meaning solitude in Sanskrit - Was born from a simple yet powerful vision: to create a space where people could escape the chaos of everyday life and experience true peace in the lap of nature.

Our retreat is designed around the principles of sustainable living, mindful travel, and authentic rural experiences. At Ekaant, you'll find no loud music, no distractions — only nature's rhythm, traditional hospitality, and the gentle hum of wildlife.

Whether you're a solo traveller looking for quiet, a couple seeking a soulful escape, or a family wanting to introduce your children to the joys of rural India — Ekaant welcomes you with open arms and a calm heart.

methods.title: By Road
description: Well connected via NH-361 and local village roads
Ample parking available at the property

methods.title: By Train
description: Nearest railway station: Seloo (10 km), Wardha Junction (40 km)
Taxis and local autos available from stations

methods.title: By Air
description: Nearest airport: Nagpur Dr. Babasaheb Ambedkar International Airport (approx. 90 km)
Car rentals or private taxis available

questions.question: Q. Is Ekaant child-friendly?
questions.answer: Yes, children love the open spaces, animals, and orchard walks. We also have kid-safe areas and swings.

questions.question: Q. Is there mobile network or internet?
questions.answer: Mobile networks are patchy (which is a blessing!), but we do provide limited Wi-Fi for emergencies.

questions.question: Q. Can we spot tigers or wildlife here?
questions.answer: Bor Tiger Reserve is known for its tiger sightings. While we cannot guarantee sightings, safaris can be arranged, and wildlife often visits the nearby buffer zones.

questions.question: Q. Is food included in the stay?
questions.answer: Yes, we offer delicious home-style Maharashtrian meals made with locally sourced organic ingredients.

questions.question: Q. Do you allow pets?
questions.answer: Yes! Ekaant is pet-friendly. We just ask that pets are kept on leash and do not disturb the wildlife.

questions.question: Q. What is the best time to visit?
questions.answer: October to March is ideal, with pleasant weather and clear skies for stargazing. Monsoon (July-Sept) is lush and magical, too.
